pull.title: ci: Test cross-built Windows executables on Windows natively
pull.body:
This PR enables on the CI tests of cross-compiled Windows binaries on Windows.

It is important to have such tests in CI because the release binaries for Windows are also cross-compiled.

Two functional tests, `wallet_migration.py` and `wallet_multiwallet.py`, are temporarily disabled. They require fixes, such as https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31410, and adjustments for error message handling. Re-enabling these tests will be addressed in follow-up PRs.

Resolves https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31071.

The CI run in my personal repo: https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/actions/runs/12165991200.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->
### Code Coverage & Benchmarks
For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/31176.
<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| Concept ACK | [davidgumberg](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31176#issuecomment-2448653950) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with ðŸ‘Ž to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#31367](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31367) (ci: limit max stack size to 512 KiB by dergoegge)
* [#31284](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31284) (ci: Skip broken Wine64 tests by default by maflcko)
* [#31158](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31158) (build, ci: Fix linking `bitcoin-chainstate.exe` to `bitcoinkernel.dll` on Windows by hebasto)
* [#29881](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29881) (guix: use GCC 13 to build releases by fanquake)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

@achow101 @fanquake 

This PR needs the `actions/download-artifact@*` and `actions/upload-artifact@*` actions to be allowed in the repository Settings - General - Actions - General.

Concept ACK

#31172 @ https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31172/commits/7dd0ee89a092c6ec4e305fbdb0cf3afa9e41cab6 passes CI but trivially fails to start on any Windows system because Wine lacks some undocumented Windows behavior.

Thanks for the POC!

Without caching I wonder how useful this is. However, caching may be the hardest part to get right.

Taking a step back, I wonder what was the last real issue found by Wine, which wasn't found by the native Windows task? If there are none, or not too many, I think this could also be made a nightly CI task, only run on master after a merge (without caching), or in a completely separate repo. The same is done for other stuff, like the valgrind tasks, or the s390x tasks.

@maflcko 

I'll address your feedback once [new actions](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31176#issuecomment-2444060142) are enabled.
Well, if it is made a nightly task in another repo, it won't need new actions enabled.

I think this is useful, and while it is waiting for more review (and for the existing review to be addressed), it could make sense to schedule it to run regularly in a repo. For example, in one of your repos, or in a new repo, or in an existing one like https://github.com/maflcko/b-c-nightly/ .

rename.from: [POC] ci: Test cross-built Windows executables on Windows natively
rename.to: ci: Test cross-built Windows executables on Windows natively

events.body:
Reworked. The GHA job now re-uses `ci/test/00_setup_env_win64.sh`.

Added caching for `depends/built` and Ccache.
It would be good to mention in the pull request description one sentence on why this is a good idea, instead of just a single word "fixes #ref" and a link to a GHA run.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
ðŸ™ This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

ci: Move "Windows cross" job from Cirrus CI to GHA CI

This change is required for testing cross-built executables on Windows
natively.

events.message: ci: Test cross-built Windows executables on Windows natively

events.body:
Rebased.

> It would be good to mention in the pull request description one sentence on why this is a good idea, instead of just a single word "fixes #ref" and a link to a GHA run.

Right. I forgot about that when undrafted this PR. Should be okay now.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -268,3 +268,62 @@ jobs:
           path: ${{ env.CCACHE_DIR }}
           # https://github.com/actions/cache/blob/main/tips-and-workarounds.md#update-a-cache
           key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}
+
+  windows-cross-build:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    name: Cross-build to Windows
+    container: debian:bookworm
comments.body:
Forgot to copy the comment?

```suggestion
    container: debian:bookworm  # Check that https://packages.debian.org/bookworm/g++-mingw-w64-x86-64-posix (version 12.2, similar to guix) can cross-compile
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -268,3 +268,62 @@ jobs:
           path: ${{ env.CCACHE_DIR }}
           # https://github.com/actions/cache/blob/main/tips-and-workarounds.md#update-a-cache
           key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}
+
+  windows-cross-build:

+    name: Cross-build to Windows
+    container: debian:bookworm
comments.body: Also, would be good to remove (in the same commit) `wine` from `ci/test/00_setup_env_win64.sh`, or at least set `RUN_UNIT_TESTS=false`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -268,3 +268,62 @@ jobs:
           path: ${{ env.CCACHE_DIR }}
           # https://github.com/actions/cache/blob/main/tips-and-workarounds.md#update-a-cache
           key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}
+
+  windows-cross-build:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    name: Cross-build to Windows
+    container: debian:bookworm
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v4
+
+      - name: Install required packages
+        run: |
+          apt-get update
+          apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y build-essential pkg-config curl ca-certificates ccache python3 cmake nsis g++-mingw-w64-x86-64-posix
comments.body: IIRC the Ubuntu mirrors are often down, so this would lead to intermittent issues without caching.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -268,3 +268,62 @@ jobs:
           path: ${{ env.CCACHE_DIR }}
           # https://github.com/actions/cache/blob/main/tips-and-workarounds.md#update-a-cache
           key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}
+
+  windows-cross-build:
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    name: Cross-build to Windows
+    container: debian:bookworm
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout

+
+      - name: Install required packages
+        run: |
+          apt-get update
+          apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y build-essential pkg-config curl ca-certificates ccache python3 cmake nsis g++-mingw-w64-x86-64-posix
+
+      - name: Build depends
+        working-directory: depends
+        run: |
+          make -j$(nproc) HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32 LOG=1 NO_QT=1
comments.body: At least with QT, this may be too slow without caching.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -268,3 +268,62 @@ jobs:

comments.body: Correct, but it isn't using the Ubuntu mirror. It is using the GHA mirror. Using a GHA cache to sidestep the GHA mirror seems a no-op, no?

           # https://github.com/actions/cache/blob/main/tips-and-workarounds.md#update-a-cache
           key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}
+

+    name: Cross-build to Windows
+    container: debian:bookworm
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout

+
+      - name: Install required packages
+        run: |
+          apt-get update
+          apt-get install --no-install-recommends -y build-essential pkg-config curl ca-certificates ccache python3 cmake nsis g++-mingw-w64-x86-64-posix

@@ -268,3 +268,62 @@ jobs:
           path: ${{ env.CCACHE_DIR }}
           # https://github.com/actions/cache/blob/main/tips-and-workarounds.md#update-a-cache
           key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}

+    container: debian:bookworm

@@ -12,7 +12,8 @@ export HOST=x86_64-w64-mingw32
 export DPKG_ADD_ARCH="i386"
 export PACKAGES="nsis g++-mingw-w64-x86-64-posix wine-binfmt wine64 wine32 file"

@@ -216,6 +216,93 @@ jobs:
         shell: cmd
         run: py -3 test\functional\test_runner.py --jobs %NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS% --ci --quiet --tmpdirprefix=%RUNNER_TEMP% --combinedlogslen=99999999 --timeout-factor=%TEST_RUNNER_TIMEOUT_FACTOR% %TEST_RUNNER_EXTRA%
 
+  windows-cross:
+    name: 'Windows cross, no tests'
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    if: ${{ vars.SKIP_BRANCH_PUSH != 'true' || github.event_name == 'pull_request' }}
+
+    env:
+      FILE_ENV: './ci/test/00_setup_env_win64.sh'
+      DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_CACHE_FOLDERS: 1
+      DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_OUT_FOLDER: 1
+
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout
+        uses: actions/checkout@v4
+
+      - name: Set environment variables
+        run: |
+          echo "BASE_ROOT_DIR=${{ runner.temp }}" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          echo "DEPENDS_DIR=${{ runner.temp }}/depends" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          echo "CCACHE_DIR=${{ runner.temp }}/ccache_dir" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          echo "BASE_OUTDIR=${{ github.workspace }}/out" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          # Required for the next step.
+          cp ${{ env.FILE_ENV }} depends/
+
+      - name: Depends fingerprint
+        id: depends_fingerprint
+        run: |
+          echo "hash=${{ hashFiles('depends/**') }}" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
+
+      - name: Depends cache
+        uses: actions/cache@v4
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ${{ env.DEPENDS_DIR }}/built
+          key: ${{ github.job }}-depends-${{ steps.depends_fingerprint.outputs.hash }}
+
+      - name: Restore Ccache cache
+        id: ccache-cache
+        uses: actions/cache/restore@v4
+        with:
+          path: ${{ env.CCACHE_DIR }}
+          key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}
+          restore-keys: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-
+
+      - name: CI script
+        env:
+          # Using the "Release" build type to avoid oversized executables to pass to the following job.
+          CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE: 'Release'
+        run: ./ci/test_run_all.sh
+
+      - name: Save Ccache cache
+        uses: actions/cache/save@v4
+        if: github.event_name != 'pull_request' && steps.ccache-cache.outputs.cache-hit != 'true'
+        with:
+          path: ${{ env.CCACHE_DIR }}
+          key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}
+
+      - name: Upload built executables
+        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
+        with:
+          name: x86_64-w64-mingw32-executables-${{ github.run_id }}
+          path: |
+            out/bin/bitcoind.exe
+            out/bin/test_bitcoin.exe
+            out/bin/bench_bitcoin.exe
+
+  windows-native-test:
+    name: 'Test on Windows'
+    runs-on: windows-2022
+    needs: windows-cross
+    steps:
+      - name: Download built executables
+        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
+        with:
+          name: x86_64-w64-mingw32-executables-${{ github.run_id }}
+
+      - name: Run bitcoind.exe
+        run: |
+          .\bitcoind.exe -version
+
+      - name: Run benchmarks
+        run: |
+          .\bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high
+
+      - name: Run tests
+        run: |
+          .\test_bitcoin.exe
comments.body: Would be nice to run the util and functional tests as well

+        with:

+            out/bin/test_bitcoin.exe
+            out/bin/bench_bitcoin.exe
+
+  windows-native-test:
+    name: 'Test on Windows'
+    runs-on: windows-2022
+    needs: windows-cross
+    steps:
+      - name: Download built executables
+        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
+        with:
+          name: x86_64-w64-mingw32-executables-${{ github.run_id }}

+      - name: Run bitcoind.exe
+        run: |

comments.body:
Thanks! [Done](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31176#issuecomment-2512046722).

However, a few functional tests fail...

comments.body:
IIRC chmod does not work on Windows, so a workaround may be needed for the test failure. 

Not sure about the `wallet_migration.py` failure. Another workaround may be needed there.

Also, the `wallet_migration` test won't be running after https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31248, so the previous releases tests should probably be run as well here.

+        uses: actions/checkout@v4
+
+      - name: Set environment variables
+        run: |
+          echo "BASE_ROOT_DIR=${{ runner.temp }}" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          echo "DEPENDS_DIR=${{ runner.temp }}/depends" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          echo "CCACHE_DIR=${{ runner.temp }}/ccache_dir" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          echo "BASE_OUTDIR=${{ github.workspace }}/out" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
+          # Required for the next step.
+          cp ${{ env.FILE_ENV }} depends/
+
+      - name: Depends fingerprint
+        id: depends_fingerprint
+        run: |
+          echo "hash=${{ hashFiles('depends/**') }}" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
+
+      - name: Depends cache
+        uses: actions/cache@v4
+        with:
+          path: |
+            ${{ env.DEPENDS_DIR }}/built
+          key: ${{ github.job }}-depends-${{ steps.depends_fingerprint.outputs.hash }}
+
+      - name: Restore Ccache cache
+        id: ccache-cache
+        uses: actions/cache/restore@v4
+        with:
+          path: ${{ env.CCACHE_DIR }}
+          key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}
+          restore-keys: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-
+
+      - name: CI script
+        env:
+          # Using the "Release" build type to avoid oversized executables to pass to the following job.
+          CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE: 'Release'
+        run: ./ci/test_run_all.sh
+
+      - name: Save Ccache cache
+        uses: actions/cache/save@v4
+        if: github.event_name != 'pull_request' && steps.ccache-cache.outputs.cache-hit != 'true'
+        with:
+          path: ${{ env.CCACHE_DIR }}
+          key: ${{ github.job }}-ccache-${{ github.run_id }}
+
+      - name: Upload built executables
+        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
+        with:
+          name: x86_64-w64-mingw32-executables-${{ github.run_id }}
+          path: |
+            out/bin/bitcoind.exe
+            out/bin/test_bitcoin.exe
+            out/bin/bench_bitcoin.exe
+
+  windows-native-test:
+    name: 'Test on Windows'
+    runs-on: windows-2022
+    needs: windows-cross
+    steps:
+      - name: Download built executables
+        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
+        with:
+          name: x86_64-w64-mingw32-executables-${{ github.run_id }}
+
+      - name: Run bitcoind.exe
+        run: |
+          .\bitcoind.exe -version
+
+      - name: Run benchmarks
+        run: |
+          .\bench_bitcoin.exe -sanity-check -priority-level=high
+
+      - name: Run tests
+        run: |
+          .\test_bitcoin.exe
comments.body: (Functional tests could be handled in a follow-up, if you want)

> (Functional tests could be handled in a follow-up, if you want)

The problematic tests have been disabled and documented.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -71,6 +71,13 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
    fi # End temporary exclusion
   fi
 
+  if [ -n "$DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_BUILD_FOLDER" ] ; then
comments.body:
I am halfway thinking that this can be put under the `DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_CCACHE_FOLDER`. Either keeping the name or renaming it.

This avoids a complexity explosion for stuff that is only used by GHA IIRC.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -71,6 +71,13 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
    fi # End temporary exclusion
   fi
 
+  if [ -n "$DANGER_CI_ON_HOST_BUILD_FOLDER" ] ; then
comments.body:
Six lines of a simple conditional statement hardly constitute a "complexity explosion" :)

Since this functionality is currently needed for just one job, Iâ€™d prefer to leave it as is.
